##Conceptual
###1
###2
(a) $(n-j)/n$ That is the probability of not $j$ is the total probability minus the probability of $j$.
(b) $(n-j)/n$ The probabilty is the same as the 1st bootstrap observation. 
(c) Bootstraping observations are independent, so the outcome of each observation does not affect the outcome of the $n$th observation.
(d) `r 1-1/5`
(e) `r 1-1/100`
(f) `r 1-1/10000`
